{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Full Stack Mobile Engineer",
  "description": "Advantage Health Africa is a health care company that provides access to Quality and affordable medication using technology.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack Mobile Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and maintain scalable mobile applications.
	Build and manage APIs using&nbsp;NestJS&nbsp;with&nbsp;PostgreSQL&nbsp;as the database.
	Implement&nbsp;CI/CD pipelines&nbsp;with containerized deployments.
	Integrate caching strategies for performance optimization.
	Ensure&nbsp;API security&nbsp;and follow best practices in authentication and data protection.
	Work with&nbsp;AI systems&nbsp;integration where required.
	Develop and maintain&nbsp;design systems&nbsp;for consistent UI/UX.
	Implement testing strategies to ensure high-quality deliverables.
	Optimize app performance across multiple platforms.
	Utilize&nbsp;WebSockets (WS)&nbsp;and&nbsp;Server-Sent Events (SSE)&nbsp;for real-time features.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in&nbsp;Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field&nbsp;(Master&rsquo;s is an added advantage).
	Proven experience as a Full Stack Mobile Engineer.
	Strong knowledge of&nbsp;NestJS, PostgreSQL, and modern mobile frameworks.
	Hands-on experience with&nbsp;CI/CD&nbsp;and&nbsp;containerization&nbsp;(e.g., Docker).
	Familiarity with&nbsp;AI systems integration.
	Solid understanding of caching, design systems, and performance optimization.
	Good knowledge of&nbsp;API security&nbsp;and testing frameworks.
	Experience with&nbsp;real-time communication tools&nbsp;(WS, SSE).
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent teamwork and communication abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@advantagehealthafrica.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",

Full Stack Mobile Engineer Job at Advantage Health Africa




        
    

        
        Advantage Health Africa is a health care company that provides access to Quality and affordable medication using technology.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack Mobile Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Design, develop, and maintain scalable mobile applications.
	Build and manage APIs using NestJS with PostgreSQL as the database.
	Implement CI/CD pipelines with containerized deployments.
	Integrate caching strategies for performance optimization.
	Ensure API security and follow best practices in authentication and data protection.
	Work with AI systems integration where required.
	Develop and maintain design systems for consistent UI/UX.
	Implement testing strategies to ensure high-quality deliverables.
	Optimize app performance across multiple platforms.
	Utilize WebSockets (WS) and Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time features.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field (Master’s is an added advantage).
	Proven experience as a Full Stack Mobile Engineer.
	Strong knowledge of NestJS, PostgreSQL, and modern mobile frameworks.
	Hands-on experience with CI/CD and containerization (e.g., Docker).
	Familiarity with AI systems integration.
	Solid understanding of caching, design systems, and performance optimization.
	Good knowledge of API security and testing frameworks.
	Experience with real-time communication tools (WS, SSE).
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent teamwork and communication abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@advantagehealthafrica.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, SME Lending",
  "description": "Fast Credit Limited (FCL) was established in line with Central Bank of Nigeria regulations to carry out the business of financing personal, business and emergency loans. We also create a platform for the investment of wholesale funds via investment notes and borrowings from individual and institutions for good returns and fund safety.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head, SME Lending

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Industry: Financial Services

Summary


	Fast Credit is seeking a dynamic and experienced Head, SME Lending to lead our SME portfolio and drive growth across the segment.
	This role is ideal for a seasoned professional who combines strong commercial acumen with deep expertise in SME lending, governance, collections, and recovery.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute strategies to grow SME lending portfolio in alignment with business objectives.
	Lead sales, product innovation, and channel development initiatives that enhance market share.
	Oversee governance, credit risk, and portfolio quality, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards.
	Drive effective collections and recovery strategies to maintain asset quality.
	Provide strong leadership, coaching, and performance management for the SME team.
	Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including regulators, partners, and customers.


Requirements


	Minimum of 10 years of experience in financial services sales, with at least 6 years in SME lending.
	Strong track record of driving SME lending growth and achieving commercial targets.
	Proven expertise in governance, risk management, and credit portfolio oversight.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.
	Demonstrated ability to manage collections, recovery, and high-performing teams.


What We Offer


	A leadership opportunity in a fast-growing financial institution.
	Competitive compensation and benefits package.
	A collaborative culture focused on performance and impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV to:&nbsp;hcm@fastcredit-ng.com&nbsp;using &quot;Head, SME Lending Application&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Head, SME Lending Job at Fast Credit Limited




        
    

        
        Fast Credit Limited (FCL) was established in line with Central Bank of Nigeria regulations to carry out the business of financing personal, business and emergency loans. We also create a platform for the investment of wholesale funds via investment notes and borrowings from individual and institutions for good returns and fund safety.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, SME Lending

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Industry: Financial Services

Summary
     

            
    




	Fast Credit is seeking a dynamic and experienced Head, SME Lending to lead our SME portfolio and drive growth across the segment.
	This role is ideal for a seasoned professional who combines strong commercial acumen with deep expertise in SME lending, governance, collections, and recovery.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute strategies to grow SME lending portfolio in alignment with business objectives.
	Lead sales, product innovation, and channel development initiatives that enhance market share.
	Oversee governance, credit risk, and portfolio quality, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards.
	Drive effective collections and recovery strategies to maintain asset quality.
	Provide strong leadership, coaching, and performance management for the SME team.
	Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including regulators, partners, and customers.


Requirements


	Minimum of 10 years of experience in financial services sales, with at least 6 years in SME lending.
	Strong track record of driving SME lending growth and achieving commercial targets.
	Proven expertise in governance, risk management, and credit portfolio oversight.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.
	Demonstrated ability to manage collections, recovery, and high-performing teams.


What We Offer


	A leadership opportunity in a fast-growing financial institution.
	Competitive compensation and benefits package.
	A collaborative culture focused on performance and impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hcm@fastcredit-ng.com using "Head, SME Lending Application" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
